details.details: This is tiny fortunes! A fun little iOS Application that delivers you a personalized fortune everyday :)

text.text: Tiny Fortunes is an iOS Application!
Designed and developed the Tiny Fortunes application in Swift using UIKit. This was such a great learning experience for me and was so cool to see how it all came together!

childMarkdownRemark.html: Designed and developed the Tiny Fortunes application in Swift using UIKit. This was such a great learning experience for me and was so cool to see how it all came together!

body.body: The backend of this application was built with NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB to store user information that was collected upon account creation. When creating a new user account, the user will ideally fill out the question form that pops up and this will give us better insight into how to target and customize the fortune that each user will receive. The backend stores this information as well as provides JWT authentication.

childMarkdownRemark.html: The backend of this application was built with NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB to store user information that was collected upon account creation. When creating a new user account, the user will ideally fill out the question form that pops up and this will give us better insight into how to target and customize the fortune that each user will receive. The backend stores this information as well as provides JWT authentication.

text.text: Finally, I also developed a frontend React website for admin users to manage fortunes and users. This way, I can easily add additional fortunes or edit/delete existing ones. Furthermore, it is so easy to target specific groups of users (for ex. users who are night owls) by filtering through the fortunes and having them appear only if they satisfy a set of conditions. It is also super easy to see how many users there and adding additional fortunes is very intuitive.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Finally, I also developed a frontend React website for admin users to manage fortunes and users. This way, I can easily add additional fortunes or edit/delete existing ones. Furthermore, it is so easy to target specific groups of users (for ex. users who are night owls) by filtering through the fortunes and having them appear only if they satisfy a set of conditions. The backend of this application was built with NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB to store user information that was collected upon account creation. When creating a new user account, the user will ideally fill out the question form that pops up and this will give us better insight into how to target and customize the fortune that each user will receive. The backend stores this information as well as provides JWT authentication.

The backend stores this information as well as provides JWT authentication.
